Cookie Policy

**INFORMATION ABOUT COOKIES**

The Brooge Energy’s website uses cookies, which means that cookies are placed on your device (computer, mobile phone or tablet) when you click “OK” on Cookie Banner which appears when you first visit Brooge Energy website. We collect information about you, as long as you consent to this. This concerns the following information:

  * Which pages you have looked at and when  • Which browser you use;  • Your geographic location when applicable



**PURPOSE OF THE DATA COLLECTION AND STORAGE PERIOD**

The purpose of collecting cookies is to improve your user experience and display relevant material and the compilation of statistics.

The storage period for this information depends on the purpose for which it was initially collected

**DISCLOSURE OF DATA**

The Brooge Energy uses several different third-party services on our pages. Sometimes these services also use cookies.

These third-party components mean that the holder of the third-party component, such as Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Linked-in or Google, collects technical data on your browser, IP address, and which pages you visit at Brooge website. If you are still signed-in to your third-party accounts such as Facebook when you visit our website it is possible for them to associate these data with your profile. 

**WHAT ARE COOKIES**

A cookie is a small data file that is stored on your device and associated with its IP address. A cookie allows us to recognize your device if you make multiple return visits, and it lets us see which pages you navigate to on the website.

**HOW TO TURN OFF COOKIES**

You can stop cookies being stored on your computer by selecting the appropriate settings in your browser. But if you do not accept cookies, there may be some features on the website that you are unable to use.

If you do not want us to place cookies on your computer, you can block the use of cookies in your browser.

If you do not want our website cookies, in most browsers you can select advanced cookie settings under Internet Options and add this domain to the list of websites that you want to block cookies from.

Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly Necessary Cookie should be enabled at all times so that we can save your preferences for cookie settings.

Enable or Disable Cookies

If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.

Enable All Save Settings

#  Annual General Meeting 2023

The board of directors of Brooge Energy Limited (the “Company”) is soliciting proxies for the annual general meeting of the Company to be held on December 15, 2023 at 6:00 pm Gulf Standard Time, or 9:00 a.m. U.S. Eastern Standard Time.

The Company is a “foreign private issuer” within the meaning of Rule 3b-4 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (“Exchange Act”). Foreign private issuers are exempt from the proxy rules under Rule 3a12-3(b) of the Exchange Act. As such, the Company follows local law proxy solicitation rules rather than U.S. federal or NASDAQ rules regarding proxy solicitation.

You can review and download the proxy statement and other proxy materials on below links:

[Notice of Annual General Meeting 2023](https://broogeenergy.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Brooge-Energy-Limited-AGM-Notice-2023.pdf)[Download](https://broogeenergy.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Brooge-Energy-Limited-AGM-Notice-2023.pdf)

The Brooge Energy uses several different third-party services on our pages. Sometimes these services also use cookies.

These third-party components mean that the holder of the third-party component, such as Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Linked-in or Google, collects technical data on your browser, IP address, and which pages you visit at Brooge website. If you are still signed-in to your third-party accounts such as Facebook when you visit our website it is possible for them to associate these data with your profile. 

**WHAT ARE COOKIES**

A cookie is a small data file that is stored on your device and associated with its IP address. A cookie allows us to recognize your device if you make multiple return visits, and it lets us see which pages you navigate to on the website.

**HOW TO TURN OFF COOKIES**

You can stop cookies being stored on your computer by selecting the appropriate settings in your browser. But if you do not accept cookies, there may be some features on the website that you are unable to use.

If you do not want us to place cookies on your computer, you can block the use of cookies in your browser.

If you do not want our website cookies, in most browsers you can select advanced cookie settings under Internet Options and add this domain to the list of websites that you want to block cookies from.

Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly Necessary Cookie should be enabled at all times so that we can save your preferences for cookie settings.

Enable or Disable Cookies

If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.

Cookie Policy

**INFORMATION ABOUT COOKIES**

The Brooge Energy’s website uses cookies, which means that cookies are placed on your device (computer, mobile phone or tablet) when you click “OK” on Cookie Banner which appears when you first visit Brooge Energy website. We collect information about you, as long as you consent to this. This concerns the following information:

  * Which pages you have looked at and when  • Which browser you use;  • Your geographic location when applicable



**PURPOSE OF THE DATA COLLECTION AND STORAGE PERIOD**

The purpose of collecting cookies is to improve your user experience and display relevant material and the compilation of statistics.

The storage period for this information depends on the purpose for which it was initially collected

**DISCLOSURE OF DATA**

The Brooge Energy uses several different third-party services on our pages. Sometimes these services also use cookies.

These third-party components mean that the holder of the third-party component, such as Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Linked-in or Google, collects technical data on your browser, IP address, and which pages you visit at Brooge website. If you are still signed-in to your third-party accounts such as Facebook when you visit our website it is possible for them to associate these data with your profile. 

**WHAT ARE COOKIES**

A cookie is a small data file that is stored on your device and associated with its IP address. A cookie allows us to recognize your device if you make multiple return visits, and it lets us see which pages you navigate to on the website.

**HOW TO TURN OFF COOKIES**

You can stop cookies being stored on your computer by selecting the appropriate settings in your browser. But if you do not accept cookies, there may be some features on the website that you are unable to use.

If you do not want us to place cookies on your computer, you can block the use of cookies in your browser.

If you do not want our website cookies, in most browsers you can select advanced cookie settings under Internet Options and add this domain to the list of websites that you want to block cookies from.

Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly Necessary Cookie should be enabled at all times so that we can save your preferences for cookie settings.

Enable or Disable Cookies

If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.

Enable All Save Settings
